remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawListViewItemEventArgs.State%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawListViewSubItemEventArgs.ItemState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties. For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawItem?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawSubItem?displayProperty=fullName> events.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to provide custom drawing for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control in the example has a gradient background. Subitems with negative values have a red foreground and a black background.
A handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawItem?displayProperty=fullName> event draws the background for entire items and for the column headers row. A handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawSubItem?displayProperty=fullName> event draws the text values and both the text and background for subitems that have negative values.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu> component provides a way to switch between the details view and the list. In the list view, only the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawItem?displayProperty=fullName> event is fired. In this case, the text and background are both drawn in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawItem?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.
For the complete example, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.OwnerDraw%2A?displayProperty=fullName> reference topic.
